resources.string: Tap + to write your first diary
No entries found.\nRecord your day today.
Are you sure you want to delete this entry?
You see the world as beautiful and feel overwhelming rapture. You are overflowing with energy and positivity.
Right now, enjoy this intense happiness to the fullest. Recording this moment in a diary or through creative work will yield great results.
Your heart feels light and happy, bringing a natural smile to your face. You find joy in the little things.
Your bright energy strengthens those around you. Keep this feeling alive with a light walk or your favorite music.
Your mind is calm and peaceful, like a waveless sea. You are resting without any particular worries.
This serenity strengthens your inner self. Enjoy this quiet time fully with a warm cup of tea or meditation.
You are deeply moved by someone\'s excellence or character and feel sincere respect.
Try to emulate their strengths. Positive stimulation will be a catalyst for your personal growth.
You believe in and rely on someone or a situation without doubt. Your heart is open and at ease.
Trust is the strongest root of a relationship. Strengthen your bonds by expressing gratitude and faith to your loved ones.
It is a mature mindset to accept and acknowledge situations or results as they are.
Acceptance is the beginning of change. Instead of resisting, go with the flow, and you might see a new path.
You are frozen and repulsed by overwhelming fear. You are in a state of extreme panic.
Prioritize your safety right now. Stop everything for a moment, take deep breaths, and calm yourself. Remember, you are not alone.
You feel threatened, anxious, and have an urge to escape. You are wary that something might go wrong.
Fear is just a signal of danger. Write down your worries one by one to see if they are real problems.
You are on edge, feeling a foreboding sense that something bad might happen.
Vague worries can cloud your mind. Instead of thinking \'what if\', focus on small things you can do \'right now\'.
You are stunned, mouth agape, by something completely unexpected and massive.
This shocking experience can open new perspectives. Calm your excitement and reflect on what this situation means.
You are momentarily startled or taken aback by a sudden event.
Surprise refreshes your attention. Try to accept this change as a positive opportunity or a new discovery.
Your attention is scattered, making it hard to focus, and your mind feels adrift.
Stop what you are doing and take a breather. After a short rest, restart step by step to regain your focus.
You feel a heartbreaking pain and deep sorrow from a sense of loss.
Don\'t suppress your sadness; let yourself grieve and cry. Letting emotions out is the first step to healing.
Your heart feels heavy and depressed, lacking energy, as if everything has sunk.
Don\'t push yourself today; comfort yourself. Resting in a warm bed or a quiet space is recommended.
You are lost in deep thought, feeling a hint of melancholy and loneliness. It\'s calm but solitary.
This solitude is a good time for introspection. Organize your complex thoughts or write a diary to converse with yourself.
You feel an unbearably strong aversion and want to reject the object completely.
Strong repulsion can be a defense mechanism to protect your values. Distance yourself from the source and find peace of mind.
You find something unpleasant and repulsive, wanting to stay away. It is offensive or sickening.
Step away from the unpleasant situation and get some fresh air. Your favorite scent or a clean space will help refresh your mood.
You feel dull, lethargic, and bored due to a lack of stimulation.
Boredom can be the start of creativity. Try something unfamiliar or look for a new hobby.
You feel furious anger rising to the top of your head, hard to control.
Expressing anger now leads to regret. Leave the situation, count numbers, or breathe deeply to cool down the heat.
You are upset and offended by dissatisfaction or injustice. You might feel aggressive.
Channel this anger energy constructively. Intense exercise or cleaning is effective for relieving stress.
You feel slightly bothered and irritated by a situation or person.
You might be sensitive to small things. Close your eyes for meditation or have a favorite snack to lighten your mood.
You are alert and keeping a close watch on your surroundings against danger or opportunity.
Preparation is good, but excessive tension brings fatigue. It\'s okay to relax your shoulders and lower your guard a bit.
You are waiting with excitement for what is to come, expecting positive results.
Excitement is the vitality of life. Imagine the future in detail and make plans to double your joy.
You are curious about an object or situation, paying attention and wanting to know more.
Follow your curiosity. New learning or experiences will enrich your life.
Joy and Trust combine to form warm and deep affection. The world feels lovely.
Love grows as you express it. Convey your heart with warm words or a small gift to your loved ones.
Trust and Fear mix into acceptance of unavoidable situations or yielding to authority.
Sometimes, going with the flow is wisdom. But listen to your inner voice so you don\'t lose yourself.
Fear and Surprise combine into a feeling of wonder towards something overwhelming or mysterious.
Enjoy the humility felt before greatness like nature or art. This inspiration will broaden your horizon.
Surprise and Sadness meet in disappointment and rejection of an unexpected negative outcome.
Disappointment is as big as the expectation. Instead of blaming, adjust your expectations and manage your mind.
Sadness and Disgust mix to create deep regret and self-reproach over past actions or oneself.
Don\'t be too hard on yourself. Mistakes are opportunities for growth. Reflect and move towards a better tomorrow.
Disgust and Anger combine to look down on someone or strongly reject and ignore them.
Contempt is a poison to relationships. Try to put yourself in their shoes once more and find room in your heart.
Anger and Anticipation meet to drive forward forcefully or challenge to overcome.
Use this strong energy for constructive goals. Use it as a driving force to break through your limits, not to attack others.
Anticipation and Joy blend into positive hope and conviction that the future will go well.
Your positive attitude makes anything possible. Don\'t lose hope and move forward vigorously. Good results await.
Discomfort where Joy is marred by Fear, wondering if it\'s okay to feel this way.
Don\'t postpone happiness due to excessive responsibility. You deserve to be happy. Forgive yourself.
A desire to explore new things with Trust and Surprise, wanting to know more.
The world is full of wonders. Don\'t fear questions and explore endlessly. New discoveries await you.
Fear and Sadness meet, losing hope and feeling trapped in deep darkness.
Dawn comes after the darkest night. It\'s hard now, but the light of hope will surely come. Don\'t give up.
Surprise and Disgust mix in strong denial, unable to believe the situation at hand.
It takes time to accept shocking facts. Don\'t force understanding; comfort your shocked heart first.
Sadness and Anger mix, suffering from lack compared to others\' happiness and feeling jealous.
Comparison is the thief of joy. Focus on your own precious values and strengths rather than others\' brilliance.
Disgust and Anticipation mix strangely to predict negative outcomes and mock the world.
Cynicism can be a shield against getting hurt. Try opening your heart a little to see the warm side of the world.
Anger (energy for self-assertion) and Joy combine into strong confidence in one\'s achievements.
Your achievements are rightfully proud. It will shine even more if you keep humility so pride doesn\'t become arrogance.
Anticipation and Trust (acceptance) mix to accept the future as determined fate.
Accept fate but don\'t give up on what you can pioneer. Your will can change the flow of destiny.
Joy and Surprise meet in great happiness, eyes wide open from the unexpected pleasure.
Enjoy this surprise gift of joy to the fullest. Life is full of such unexpected pleasures.
Trust and Sadness mix, immersing in past connections or memories with a wistful mood.
Memories are beautiful, but we live in the present. Use the warmth of the past to live today more fully.
Fear and Disgust meet in deep embarrassment about oneself, wanting to hide.
No one is perfect. Love even your imperfect self. You are precious enough just as you are.
Surprise and Anger mix in a strong reaction to something unreasonable or an insult.
Anger at injustice is a righteous reaction. But try to find a rational solution without being swept away by emotion.
Sadness and Anticipation mix to expect negative results and grieve before anything happens.
Negative imagination spirals. Consciously imagine positive outcomes. What you think can come true.
A complex psychology feeling strange joy or interest from repulsive objects.
You don\'t need to deny your unique interests. But look into whether it\'s healthy curiosity or an expression of inner stress.
Anger and Trust meet to overconfidence in one\'s power and trying to control others.
True leadership comes from consideration, not control. Learn to listen to others and move forward together.
Anticipation and Fear mix, nervous and unstable about the unknown future.
Anxiety is proof you want to do better. It\'s okay not to be perfect. Just take it one step at a time.
Joy and Sadness mix, beautiful but leaving a sad lingering feeling.
Every moment has two sides. Savor the depth of this moment where joy and sadness coexist.
Trust and Disgust coexist, a complex feeling of loving yet hating simultaneously.
Ambivalence is natural. Don\'t force a choice; acknowledge your confused heart as it is.
Fear and Anger collide, stuck in tension unable to fight or flee.
It feels immobile now, but an opening will appear soon. Relax your tension and observe the situation slowly.
Surprise and Anticipation mix, puzzled by a completely unpredictable future.
Confusion is a process of finding order. Don\'t rush; believe that everything will become clear with time.
You feel a desperate need to control or keep someone close, driven by fear of loss.
True connection is built on trust, not control. Creating space can actually strengthen your bond.
You bow down to authority but feel a deep sense of self-dislike for doing so.
Respecting others is good, but not at the cost of your self-worth. Stand a little taller.
A sudden threat has put you on high alert, ready to fight back.
Your instincts are sharp right now. Check if the threat is real before reacting aggressively.
An unexpected event has left you stunned and deeply saddened.
Give yourself time to process this news. It\'s okay to be shaken.
Regret has turned inward, becoming a deep dislike for yourself.
Be as kind to yourself as you would be to a friend. You are more than your mistakes.
You look down on others while secretly wanting what they have.
This bitterness hurts you most. Focus on your own path instead of judging others.
You feel a burning drive to strike back at those who wronged you.
Revenge often leaves more emptiness. Channel this energy into building your own success.
You trust blindly, perhaps ignoring signs of danger.
Trust is beautiful, but wisdom protects it. Verify before you fully open your heart.
You deny your own happiness out of guilt or fear.
Acknowledging your needs isn\'t selfish. You deserve joy just as much as anyone else.
You are curious but hesitant, torn between wanting to know and staying safe.
It\'s okay to be cautious. Take small steps to satisfy your curiosity safely.
You feel trapped and powerless, believing nothing you do matters.
Start with one tiny thing you can control. Small victories build the strength to change.
You are shocked and appalled by something deeply repulsive.
Remove yourself from the source. Protect your peace of mind.
Unfairness has festered into a deep, bitter anger over time.
Holding onto this poison harms you. Express it safely or let it go for your own sake.
You expect the worst and cynical doubts cloud your view.
Healthy skepticism is good, but don\'t close yourself off completely. Look for evidence of good.
Confidence has swollen into arrogance, blinding you to risks.
True strength includes humility. Listen to others to keep your perspective grounded.
You look forward to the future with a trusting heart.
Nurture this light. It will guide you through uncertain times.
You are happy but puzzled, unsure why or how this happened.
Just enjoy the moment. Not everything needs an immediate explanation.
You feel sorry for yourself, nursing old wounds.
It\'s okay to lick your wounds, but don\'t stay there. You have the power to heal.
Shame feels public and crushing, making you want to disappear.
This moment does not define you. Hold your head up; your worth is internal.
You are angry and confused, thrown off balance by a surprise.
Regain your footing first. Acting while dizzy with anger often leads to mistakes.
You\'ve given up on expecting better, accepting a sad status quo.
Acceptance brings peace, but don\'t lose your spark. Change is always possible.
You find amusement in mocking what you find disgusting.
Ask yourself what this mockery serves. Kindness is a higher form of intelligence.
You use your power to force others, driven by anger and a need for control.
Real power inspires rather than forces. Step back and lead with empathy.
A heavy, cold fear hangs over you, anticipating something terrible.
This shadow is often bigger than the reality. Face it one light at a time.
Recent joys make you miss the past with a tinge of sadness.
Cherish the memories, but don\'t live in them. Make new memories today.
You are torn between wanting to trust and feeling deep distaste.
Trust your gut. If something feels off, it\'s okay to keep a distance.
Opposite emotions are clashing within you.
This emotion is the most prominent feeling identified in the keyword %1$s.
This complex emotion is derived from a combination of %1$s and %2$s.
This represents a conflict between opposing emotions: %1$s and %2$s.
A model proposed by Robert Plutchik. Colors unfolding like petals represent 8 basic emotions, and adjacent emotions mix to form complex emotions.
Joy, Trust, Fear, Surprise, Sadness, Disgust, Anger, Anticipation. Opposite emotions have opposing properties.
Emotions formed by combining two basic emotions.\nFor example, Joy + Trust = Love.
The same Joy can be divided into Serenity (Weak) â†’ Joy (Medium) â†’ Ecstasy (Strong) depending on intensity.
